synopsis: In this engaging episode of Pineapple Blunt Rotation, hosts Devam and Ahir, along with special guest Garrett, dive deep into the complexities of body image and the gym. They share personal experiences, discuss the impact of societal standards, and encourage listeners to foster a positive relationship with their bodies and fitness journeys.
quotes: The horror is persistent, but so do we.
If you don't have a positive relationship with the gym, it's time for a change.
You can’t compare yourself to someone who is doing something you can’t even do, even if you wanted to.
If you want to make a change, do it for the right reasons, not because you hate yourself.
You need to enjoy what you're doing; it’s hard to stay motivated if you really hate it.
The whole point of going to the gym is to put your body under stress to create change.
Drink water—it's the simplest way to improve your physical and mental health.
If you're going to the gym to improve the way you look, also go to the gym because you enjoy it.
Comparison is the thief of joy.
